title: Mole
description: The SI unit of amount of substance. One mole contains exactly 6.022 140 76 x 10^23 elementary entities. This number is the fixed numerical value of the Avogadro constant, N_A, when expressed in the unit mol^-1 and is called the Avogadro number. The amount of substance, symbol n, of a system is a measure of the number of specified elementary entities. An elementary entity may be an atom, a molecule, an ion, an electron, any other particle or specified group of particles
